author: Michael Larabel
description: In addition to showing the need for unifying DRM driver-side APIs within the Linux kernel, NVIDIA's Linux graphics driver team at XDC2025 also showcased the shortcomings of screencasting under Wayland...
title: NVIDIA Highlights The Shortcomings With Wayland Screencasting

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Qt toolkit is moving away from directly relying on the CPU's RDRAND and RDSEED instructions for random number generation and to instead rely on the OS-supplied entropy...
title: Qt Moves Away From Direct RDRAND/RDSEED Usage For Better Performance & Less Bugs

author: Michael Larabel
description: The upcoming Linux 6.19 kernel cycle is set to introduce initial Xe3P_LPD GPU support for Nova Lake as well as beginning to build out support for the Crescent Island graphics card. Now joining DRM-Next with that initial Intel Xe3P_LPD code for Linux 6.19 is being able to drive displays with that Xe3 hardware...
title: Linux 6.19 Landing Initial Display Support For Xe3P_LPD / Nova Lake

author: Michael Larabel
description: One of the NVIDIA presentations at the recent XDC2025 developer conference was not around the NVIDIA driver itself but the ongoing fragmentation that's happening within the Linux Direct Rendering Manager (DRM) subsystem and arguing the need for unifying more driver-side APIs for supporting different Linux DRM clinets...
title: NVIDIA Linux Engineer Highlights The Need For Unifying DRM Driver-Side API

author: Michael Larabel
description: Following the recent idea floated to consider C++20 as the default C++ language dialect by the GCC compiler rather than C++17, it was discovered that the GNU Compiler Collection itself has problems building in C++20 model...
title: GCC Developer Discovers "Our Codebase Isn't Fully C++20 Ready"

author: Michael Larabel
description: As part of this week's sound subsystem fixes ahead of today's Linux 6.18-rc6 kernel release is adding some quirks for supporting the PureAudio Lotus DAC5 and other PureAudio audio hardware...
title: PureAudio Lotus DAC5 & Other PureAudio Hardware Supported For Linux 6.18
